title: Bombay milk scheme
creator_contributor_role: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information, production company
subject_group: Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Agriculture - Developing countries
Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Food supply - Developing countries

description: To improve the supply and quality of milk in Bombay, the Government began construction in 1948 of a dairy farm and passed a law requiring that all cattle herds be moved outside the city limits. The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations sent an expert in animal husbandry and a dairy technologist to work with local officials and experts.
